title: Pics: Frosty unveils ‘Green Machine’ for 2017
text:
Supercars: Mark Winterbottom reveals new Bottle-O livery for 2017 February 17, 2017 2:00pm by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS THE covers are off Mark Winterbottom’s new Bottle-O Ford livery for the 2017 Virgin Australia Supercars Championship season. 
The No. 5 returns to Frosty’s Ford after giving up the champion’s No. 1 at the end of 2016, unveiling his 2017 livery after shaking down a brand-new car at Winton on Thursday. 
“You won’t be able to miss me out there this year!” Winterbottom said. 
“The car looks great with the green wheels in particular. It really is a mean, green machine this year. 
“I’m definitely hungry to go out there and put wins on the board. I certainly didn’t meet my expectations last year and that’s something that needs to change in 2017. Mark Winterbottom and his 2017 Bottle-O Ford Falcon Supercar. Source: Supplied 
“We need to be at the top of our game if we want to be able to challenge the guys at the front and I think we have the potential, we just need to work that little bit harder. 
“The guys and girls back at the workshop want it too. The changes they’ve all been working on at the workshop over the break look really positive so I’m looking forward to giving this new tyre a try and seeing how things go at the test day. Mark Winterbottom’s new-look Bottle-O Ford Falcon for 2017. Source: Supplied 
“I’m proud to be representing so many great brands again this year, particularly long-term supporters in The Bottle-O. We got a couple of wins for them last year but a few more this year would be good.” Mark Winterbottom’s new-look Bottle-O Ford Falcon for 2017. Source: Supplied 
Winterbottom’s is the second livery to be revealed among Prodrive’s four-car fleet, following the unveiling of Jason Bright’s Mega petroleum livery on Wednesday. Mark Winterbottom’s new-look Bottle-O Ford Falcon for 2017. Source: Supplied 
Chaz Mostert’s Supercheap Auto livery will be revealed on Tuesday ahead of Supercars’ tyre test day at Sydney Motorsport Park, while Cam Waters’ new livery will be revealed in the week leading up to the season-opening Clipsal 500 Adelaide on March 2-5. Mark Winterbottom’s new-look Bottle-O Ford Falcon for 2017. Source: Supplied
